value.title: Control Azure services with the CLI
value.excerpt: Learn the steps to install the Azure CLI locally, create a website, and manage Azure resources using the CLI.

value.excerpt: Describe the identity and access management capabilities of Microsoft 365

value.title: Execute an Azure Function with triggers
value.excerpt: This module demos some of the most common types of triggers for executing Azure Functions and how to configure them to execute your logic.

value.title: Explore the authentication capabilities of Azure AD
value.excerpt: Explore the authentication capabilities of Azure AD

value.title: Host a web application with Azure App service
value.excerpt: Create a website in the programming language of your choice through the hosted web app platform in Azure App Service.

value.title: Host your domain on Azure DNS
value.excerpt: Learn how to host your domain on Azure DNS.

value.title: Introduction to Python
value.excerpt: Learn about the Python programming language, how to execute statements and scripts, declare variables, and create a basic Python app.

value.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
value.excerpt: Learn about SRE, an engineering discipline that helps you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

value.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure’s role-based access control to effectively manage your team’s access to Azure resources.

value.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
value.excerpt: Explore the broad array of Azure technologies that analyze text or images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data.

value.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
value.excerpt: Learn about the Site Reliability Engineering approach to the challenge of assuring reliability and gain a better understanding of why it matters.

value.title: Introduction to Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Windows Virtual Desktop to deliver remote desktop and remote app experiences in Microsoft Azure.

value.title: Azure API for FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Michael Hansen joins Scott Hanselman to explain what FHIR is and how to get started with FHIR on Azure. Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (or, FHIR) is a new standard for representing and exchanging healthcare data. Developed by the HL7 community to address problems with interoperability, pieces

value.excerpt: Using a bastion host can help limit threats such as port scanning and other types of malware targeting your VMs. Ashish Jain joins Scott Hanselman to show how Azure Bastion gives you secure and seamless RDP and SSH access to your virtual machines. value.title: Learn how Microsoft supports using multifactor authentication as part of a cybersecurity solution
value.excerpt: Multifactor authentication helps secure your environment and resources by requiring that your users confirm their identity by using multiple authentication methods, like a phone call, text message, mobile app notification, or one-time password. You can use multifactor authentication both on-premises and in the cloud to add security for accessing Microsoft online services, remote access applications, and more. This learning path provides an overview of how to use multifactor authentication as part of a cybersecurity solution.The deadline for agencies to adopt multifactor authentication and encryption at rest and in transit to the maximum extent (and report on progress every 60 days), per Section 3 of the Executive Order on Improving the Nation's Cybersecurity, is **November 8, 2021**.

topItems.title: Secure Azure Active Directory users with Multi-Factor Authentication
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use multi-factor authentication with Azure AD to harden your user accounts.

value.title: Align requirements with cloud types and service models in Azure
value.excerpt: Discover Azure's three approaches to deploying cloud resources -- public, private, and hybrid -- and learn the difference each makes in your Azure services.

value.title: Analyze your Azure infrastructure by using Azure Monitor logs
value.excerpt: Use Azure Monitor logs to extract valuable information about your infrastructure from log data.

value.title: Introduction to Azure SQL
value.excerpt: This module introduces Azure SQL. Learn about various deployment options and service tiers and what to use for your organization.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

value.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how using key principles throughout your cloud architecture can help you design and build a solid architectural foundation that you can continuously improve.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
value.excerpt: Learn how to adjust your capacity based on workload and how to optimize network performance, storage, and database performance.
